meanings.definition: A nearly simultaneous firing of all the guns from one side of a warship.
meanings.sent1: The warship unleashed a powerful broadside during the battle.
meanings.sent2: The captain ordered the broadside to be fired at the enemy ship.
meanings.sent3: The sailors cheered as the broadside boomed across the sea.
meanings.sent4: The broadside of cannon fire echoed through the ocean like thunder.
meanings.sent5: The deafening broadside left the enemy ship in ruins.

meanings.sent1: The journalist's broadside against corruption gained attention.
meanings.sent2: The politician launched a scathing broadside against his opponent.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's broadside on current events had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: Her broadside of accusations hit the target with precision.
meanings.sent5: The professor's broadside on the flawed study was well-received by peers.

meanings.definition: A large sheet of paper printed on one side.
meanings.sent1: She handed out a broadside of flyers to promote the event.
meanings.sent2: The historical document was written on a broadside.
meanings.sent3: The artist used a broadside to display their latest work.
meanings.sent4: The broadside contained important information for the visitors.
meanings.sent5: The broadside fluttered in the wind, catching everyone's attention.
